text: Camba Nelson weisse. Flesje. Helder geel. Bitterzuur , licht fruitig, gistig. Smaakt idem. Beetje waterig. Niet zo mijn smaak.
Bottle. Hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma has citrus, sour elements and yeast. Taste is fruity with quite long a bit sour and quite dry aftertaste. Flavors of citrus, wheat, fruits, hay.

Hazy light orange. Full finger pillowy white head, good retention. The nose has lemon, melon, spicy hop, green banana, faint clove, raw wheat, grass. A nice, refreshing punch of lemony hops, with some exotic lime notes and nice floral notes. Some pomelo, some melon, bit of persimmon. Low banana notes, some wheatiness, some faint clove in the spicy, bitter finish. Quite prickly and with a lot of fresh grassiness. Aftertaste has some nice lingering spicy hop and bits of lemon peel. Medium to light bodied, prickly carbonation (that fits well). Tho not bringing the full range of flavours/aromas that the Nelson hops should usually do, it does make for a pretty great, refreshing hoppy weizen, not as heavy as the ones from Schneider.

5/V/17 - 33cl bottles from Geers (Oostakker) @ Abeels visiting (home) - BB: 26/X/17 (2017-577) Thanks to all for sharing the beers!
Slightly hazy blond beer, small irregular white head, unstable, dissipates immediately. Aroma: bit fruity, some citrus, white grapes. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: soft bitterness, some grapefruit, bitter, bit sourish, lemony touch, citrus. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, dry, grassy, fruity, citrus, some grapefruit.

0.33 l bottle from P&M Getränke as Camba Nelson Dry Hop Wheat at 5.3% abv, best before October 2017. Hazy, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, quite fruity, floral, moderately yeasty-spicy and slightly grassy aroma of pineapple, white grapes, lychee and some clove. Slightly sweetish, a bit sourish, fruity-grassy, floral and slightly yeasty-spicy taste of banana, pineapple, white grapes, gooseberry, lychee and some clove, followed by a short, moderately bitter, slightly tart, a little yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, minimally astringent and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very refreshing, more a Wheat Ale than a Hefeweizen, good that they brew it again!

Great beer, doesnt taste much like a weiss beer. Tidy. 

10/10 would drink it again.
Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is yeast banana peach slight herbs. Taste is fine sour yeast with some fine flowers above. Dandelion. Smooth and easy going. Full body. Nice.

0,33l bottle at home from trade with Maracuja05, big thanks. BB 25.10.2017. As Camba Nelson Dry Hop Wheat. light yellow cloudy color, small white head. smells of passion fruit, peach, bit leathery, lemon grass, earthy, some yeast. quite nice smell. medium body, soft carbonation, rather rich mouthfeel. tastes of peach, passion fruit, herbal, thyme, rosemary, lemon grass, bit chewy, light yeast. finishes lightly dry with a nice balance of thyme, exotic fruits and light citrus. quite good one, I kinda like the balance, wheat beer with a twist. good stuff.
Tap @ Stone Berlin - Hazy golden color, white head. Taste is wheat grains, coriander, low banana flavor, very nice and round Weizen. Meet sweet Highly drinkable. Superb.
22-02-17 // 330ml bottle at home. Cloudy orange beer, solid white head. Fruity yeasty nose. Taste is so fruity, strongly hopped Weizenbier, lots of grapes and some tropcial fruits. Well done Camba!

330 ml bottle from Biervana, München, bb 07.08.2017.
Orange, hazy body, with a big, fluffy, moderately lacing, white head.
Aroma of banana, dried fruits, grapes, tropical fruits, vanilla, some bread, sutle spices.
Tastes of banana, orange, grapes, bread, grains, some spices, some flowers.
Medium, a bit oily mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes a bit dry, yeasty, fruity, medium spicy, a bit bready, a bit grainy, hoppy, with grapes.

Very nice. Really lovely nose, with loads of diverse fruits. Taste has more of the typical Hefeweizen aromas, while the Nelson Sauvin grape notes are also coming through. Overall a characterful Weizen with some hoppy twist, drinks really fresh.

Ziemlich geiles Weizen. Extravagant bis unter die Fußsohlen. Vielmehr Farmhouser als Wheat. Der Nelson Hopfen bringt unbändige Koriandertraubenmadness im Getreidemantel....Anders & Very Good :)... 0,33 Flasche für 3,90 Euro. Aus der GETRÄNKE OASE in München.

From tap at tap House München. In a hefe glass. Cloudy golden yellow, large frothy white head. Wheat, lemon, grapefruit nose. High carbonation, light body, slightly sour. Nice long wheat finish with a bit of citrus added. Nice take on the classic style, not pushing the bounds too much, but still great.

Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Pours hazy amber. Aroma is mostly Nelson hops, but also some Weisse yeast. Quite a nice balance between the two. Body us medium with a crisp carbonation. Some banana shining through. Sweet. Not super refined, but it works.
Kran. Aromat banana, goździk, chmiel. W smaku goryczka niska, lekko kwaśne, nafta.
From bottle. Pours light orange, with big, white head. Pineapple, grapes, wheat, herbs, grass. A bit watery, hoppy, but pilsner like I would say, nice aroma.

Hazy golden color with small, slightly off-white head. Aroma is a combination of yeast esters, sweet wheat malt and fruity hops. Taste starts with sweet wheat malt and fruity hops which continue towards the finish, which has a light hop bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. Overall its a quite nice, hoppy hefeweizen with some really nice fruity flavors.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Nelson Weisse by Camba Bavaria at JabeerwockySa wyrazne bardzo te nelsonowe nutki, jest wysoka kwaskowatosc i duza rzeskosc, ryli cacy acz jakis smrodek po ogrzaniu. Bananogpzdzikow maloRami Rami: nutki nelsona to takie skrzyzowanie tropikow z grejfrutem i faktycznie agrestem? moze stad ta kwaskowatosc? moze odwrotnie, agrest wtorny?ciekawe to piwo tak w ogole, bardziej chyba nawet american wheat niz niemiecki weizen...Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Piana niezbyt wysoka, acz gęsta, ładnie zdobi szkło. Pachnie bardzo mocno jogurtem brzoskwiniowym (raczej to nie diacetyl), takim mocno owocowym, w stylu Fantazji. W smaku wysoko nasycone, nie tak wytrawne, bananowo - brzoskwiniowe. Goździka raczej nie uświadczyłem. Jest okej, ale chyba wolę staroszkolne podejście do weizenów.
Klasyczny hefeweizen, mętny, bananowo-goździkowy, przyjemnie pod tym względem zbalansowany. Białe winogrona i lekka naftowość ubogacają całość. Nowofalowy, bardzo przyjemny weizen.

May 15. On tap at the brewpub. It poured hazy yellow body with medium sized head. Very nice Weizen aroma, fruity, especially banana, spices, with a fine tropical fruit hop note which got even more pronounced in the flavor. Therefore, relatively bitter for a Hefeweizen, but it blended nicely in. Sweet counterpart was fruity with banana, citrus, candies, yeast with some spices as well. MEdium bodied with long, pleasant wheat and bitter herbal and plainly dry finish. Very nice.

On tap at Kaschk, Berlin. Hazy golden to yellow with a nice, white head. Fruity aroma with mild banana, some tropical fruits, hints of wheat, grapes, yeast and citrus. Moderate sweet with a pleasant acidity and nice, but mild fruity flavours. Rather refreshing on a hot day in Berlin.
Im Szimpla vom Fass getrunken. Trübgelb spritzig im Glas. Im Geschmack edle Hopfennote ohne groß Hefe und die berüchtigte Banane.
Tap at tap house munich. Hazy yellow color, white head. Aroma has wheat, lemon, hops. Basic weisse with some fruity hops.
Draught. Looks like classic German hefeweizen. Taste exactly like it - where is Nelson Sauvin - I dont know. Still decent hefeweizen.

Draft. Very cloudy yellow color with a large white head. Herbal aroma with wheat, lemon, clove. Flavor is dry and mildly tart, citric and herbal. Medium-light bodied and lively on the palate. Good, but not the best beer Ive munched on in München.

Tap @ London Stone Club Budapest.
Hazy yellow colour with white head. Wheat, banana aroma. Wheat, sweet, fruity, banana, hoppy amd bitter taste. Medium body.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 Tap. Hazy orange color with fluffy white head. Aroma is fresh, white wine, but not too hoppy. Taste is hoppy, resinous, grapey. Light-bodied. A bit watery. Silky Weizen mouthfeel. Very good, but just a bit fuller body would help it. 7-4-7-4-15
New release, October 2016, tap. Definitely fresher than the last time I had this - lots of Nelson Sauvin goodness, some wheat and bananas, but also some sweatsocks. Still full-flavoured, not watery (hops havent declined yet probably). Very nice, just a tad too phenolic in the back, keeping it from cracking the 4. 8-4-7-4-16
On draft. Murky yellow color with nice head. Cloves and slight citrus, interesting for a wheat beer.

Amber light beige with turbidity. white foam fine pore with some consistency. Presence nose yeast, fresh-cut flowers and herbs, grapes, kiwi, citrus zest, spices, cloves, banana and vanilla. Sabor in congenial and wheat malts that provide a sweet and spicy in contrast to the fruity notes of hops that provides grape, tangerine, melon, orange, banana, grass, pine and citrus peels. Fina bitterness surrounded by elegant fruit acidity and long aftertaste harmonious composition. medium body and good carbonation.

Bottle - Hazy yellow colour, foamy white head, excellent retention and lacing. Spicy wheat aromas, cloves, bananas, grapes, some tropical fruits. Sweet taste of cereals, wheat, bread, gentle hoppiness, tropical fruit notes, grapes, gooseberry, banana, yeast. Medium body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture, light hoppiness, delightful finish. Very nice, decent, but special weissbier. Must try.

(Draught at Kaschk, Berlin, 16 July 2015) Hazy yellow colour with frothy, white head. Malty, wheaty nose with bread, hay, banana, clove and floral hops. Malty, wheaty taste with notes of bread, grass, banana, clove, citrus, grass and a gentle citric bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Not really exceptional, but tasty with an interesting floral hop character. Quite enjoyable.

Tap @ Kaschk. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of bubblegum, banana, some hoppy notes, sweet esters and ripe fruits. Taste is sweet and esstery with some hops towards the end. A nice take on a Weissbeer with a tiny twist.
Golden, cloudy colour; poor white head. Wheat aroma, some cloves, bananas and citrus fruits. Wheat also in taste, some fruits, gentle tartness.

Draft at Kasck, Berlin. Pours cloudy yellow golden with an off white head. Aroma of yeast, weedy hops, citrus and banana. Flavour is light moderate sweet and bitter with a biscuity palate. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with average white head. Aroma is yeast, esteres, white grapes, wheat, slight spice. Taste is sweet, wheat, grapes, yeast and light. Bit watery body and slight bitter finish. Low carbonation.

On tap at The Tap-House Munich. Cloudy orange gold colour lasting white head. Peach and banana led ester aroma. I guess the Nelson Sauvin helps the tropical fruit aroma. A light fruity weisse. Like the two beers before its over carbonated. I just get carbonic acid instead of proper flavour. Good aroma ok in mouth but the carbonation is so harsh its almost undrinkable. After a vigorous frisking I still just get tropical fruit and overly bitter finish. Decent weisse.

Tried on tap. Hazed orange/amber colour. Aroma is citrus, cloves, strong banana and vanilla. Some light yeasty notes. Taste is like aroma, banana, tropical fruits, citrus. Low bitterness and semi sweet fruit finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Keg at Hopfenriech, Berlin, 22nd April 15. Full bodied, aroma is complex, banana and spice. Taste is rich, refreshing mix of light banana, yeast, slight nelson sauvin hop. Decent

Draught. Aroma is quite much banana, only little of clove, after some time you can feel gooseberry. Light bitterness, slightly sour. Its not hopped too much, Nelson Sauvin is only an addition in this rather typical, but tasty Hefeweizen.

Keg at Camba, Munchen Ost, 05/02/15.
Hazed orange amber with a decent off white head.
Nose is yeast esters, citric peel, spice, clove, banana, vanilla.
Taste comprises light melon, orange, banana, grassy, citric peel, faint Nelson - not shining through as much as Id have liked, hint of pine, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with light hop bitterness.
Decent hoppy weisse.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cloudy golden colour with a frothy stable medium white head. Noses of gooseberry, fresh hay, ripe kiwi with some light bready malt impressions. Very soft carbonation, smooth texture and a full body yet feels light. Bready, dough, sweet fruityness with a bitter notch. Medium yet somewhat abrupt finish. Harmonic wheat beer!

Aroma: cloves, citrus Nelson notes, banana.
Appearance: hazy straw color, nice white head.
Taste: low bitterness, citrus notes with Nelson, cloves, semi-sweet, slightly watery.
Palate: low body and medium carbonation, fruit finish.
Overall: Really good variation on the classical weizenbier, fresh and drinkable.

Draught. Hazy goldenorange in color with a whitish head. Tropical fruits, ripe mashed banana, some yeasty notes and wheat in aroma. Bit of spicy notes in taste at first, which are nicely blended with them banana and tropical fruity ones. Actually this was quite tasty and refreshing.
Bottle from my father, bought somewhere in Germany. Smell of foam banana, wheat yeast aromas and some hops. Similar taste. Some hops but not allot. thirst quencher.
Tap at Hopfenreich. Pour is murky gold, aroma is fruity, sweet, grapefruit. Taste is fruity, sweet, pineapple, sweet finish. Reminds me of a Witbier

Swingtop. Pours Cloudy Golden Orange with a thick White head. Looks great. Bold fruity hops on the nose and tongue mixed in with traditional hefe yeast notes. I love a well-hopped Hefe. I dont know why I don;t see them more often.

On tap @ BierCab. Looks really good with a tall fluffy and almost a little dense white lacing head over a cloudy orangy golden body. Wheaty heffe tones on the nose combined with a really fresh grassy hop profile. A fair amount of orange bitterness on the nose also. Smells really nice. It tastes just as nice. A bit lower than I prefer on the carbonation and its nice gliding oily in the mouth. Sweetish wheat, lots of hoppy fresh grape tones. Theres yeast and oranges also here. Its one of those extremely lightdrinkables one this. Hard to stop when youre thirsty. 10.08.2014

04.10.2014, 0,5l bottle shared with friends:
Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly fresh citrusy, wheat, hay, citrus peel, grass, yeast, banana, hops. Taste is slightly dry grassy, leafs, hops, yeast, citrus peel, grass, minerals, wheat. Medium bitterness, slightly dry grassy mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Got this bottle at Ratsherrn (Altes Maedchen) in Hamburg. Weizens tend to have banana & clove flavors; this has banana, clove, lemon, and pine. The mouthfeel is sheer joy - - full, rich, silky, frothy. The hops are an absolute sublime complement to typical weizenbier flavors - - they add a gentle sleek,piney, almost minty frame that gives this weizen a cool freshness that tempers the fruity froth. Really a fun beer, and exceptionally well integrated flavors.

Piana: Mało obfita, biała, drobnopęcherzykowa.

Kolor: Mętne ciemnozłote.

Zapach: Owocowy zapach. Konretne stężenie banana i goździka. Banan wpada w gumę balonową. Po chwili spod tego klasycznego aromatu dochodzą do głosu nuty melona, owoców tropikalnych. Spora nuta zielonego jabłka.

Smak: Wytrawne, lekko kwaskowe, owocowe. Banan, gruszka, brzoskwinia. Delikatna nuta wanilii, pieczonego banana.

Tekstura: Lekko pyliste, dość gęste. Kwaskowość przyjmuje postać orzeźwiającej świeżości.

Nasycenie: Średnio-wysokie.

Goryczka: Średnio-niska.

Pijalność: Średnio-wysoka.

Nelson Weisse przypadło mi do gustu. Trzeba przyznać, że to udany pomysł w ramach pewnej koncepcji. Tą koncepcją miało by być uatrakcyjnienie stosunkowo przewidywalnego stylu, jakim jest hefeweizen, ale jednocześnie pozostanie w ramach klasyki. Tutaj uatrakcyjnieniem była nieco podwyższona goryczka oraz rewelacyjne, stonowane egzotyczne nuty chmielowe w aromacie, które dobrze podjęły współpracę z typowymi nutami weizena. Efekt psuje trochę aldehyd octowy (zielone jabłko), ale bez dużej przesady. Osobiście wolałbym także piwo mniej wytrawne - chyba, że otoczenie byłoby bardziej upalne.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2015 Turns out it was a good idea to try this one out again. No trace of catpiss, but instead a soft, banana and vanilla laden flavour, garnished with hoppy citrusy notes that serve to complement the picture instead of dominating it. Excellent rendition of the style.

First rating: Draught at Browariat, Katowice. This one has catpiss all over it, with some additional lemony notes that make a rather artificial impression. Watery. Given the high ratings I must have come across a badly brewed batch.

Me decepcionó un poco esta Weissbier. No quiero decir que sea mala, solo que esperaba más. Destaca el olor a cítricos y banana que hace pensar que en boca será una explosión de matices, pero a mi no me lo pareció tanto. No obstante, muy buena Weissbier.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 Rerate from tap in Gundelfingen: fresh hop notes, nice sparkly light wheat base, well balanced. Tap at tap house Munich. Milky yellow, green mealy malt base, hint of the hops in the nose. Oatmeal mouthfeel. Needed more time in the tank in my opinion.
Hazy gold, tart winey nose, musty fruity body, more like a Saison than a Weisse. But fascinating...

(tap 0,5l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma : Wheat, light banana, light hops citrusy.
Appearance : Cloudy golden color. Medium white head.
Taste : Medium sweet, light bitter, light citrusy sour.
Palate : Medium body. Light creamy texture. Long bitter, light citrusy finish.
Overall : Too light aroma, nice taste. Pleasant hoppy wheat.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Hazy yellow colour, with a medium head, with bigger bubbles than usual weizen, and disappearing very fast.
Smell is clearly of Nelson hops, nice, very exotic, also some yeast, and very little the typical weizen banana note.
Taste is also very fruity, exotic, but in the end I hardly finished it. I think this kind of hops are good for IPA and similar, but not for weizen.
Light gold, cloudy, good head. Aroma and taste: soft, easy to drink, citric ending, hops. Tasty.

Color dorado muy turbio con espuma blanca y jabonosa. Aromas afrutados de manzana verde, uva y plátano. En boca es ligera, dulce y afrutada con un ligero punto ácido muy refrescante. El final es algo seco y el regusto breve. Buena.
oro velera buona schiuma media persistenza leggera spezia nota fruttata frumento leggera nota erbacea biona luppolatura acidita media abbadtanza secca
On tap at Biercab. Hazy yellow colour with white head. Wheat, banana aroma. Wheat, sweet, fruity, banana, hoppy amd bitter taste. Medium body.
Draught. Hazy, citron colour. Aroma: yeast, bananas. Taste: hints of grapes, bananas again, medium carbonation, light bitterness. Smooth, drinkable, summer wheatbeer.

Bottle from Traunstein. I was expecting a flavor more hoppy, more Nelson Sauvin, but it is actually pretty discreet. Well, after tasting, this is actually not a bad thing. It really IS a weissbier, smooth and easy to drink, with a light bitter taste which gives something to the beer. A really good combination!
Draught. Cloudy yellow with a full white head. Aroma is fruity and yeast. Flavour is banana with a little spice. Dry finsh

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, exotisch fruchtig, bananig. Geschmack hefig, bananig fruchtig, minimal würzig, sehr angenehme exotisch fruchtige Aromen.
Hazy orange pour with a medium white head. Banana and clove nose as expected; not much else going on.
The head is ok, body cloudy. It smells yeasty, malty, refreshing. The taste is aromatic, balanced, fresh, hoppy. Nice yeast-Nelson Sauvin combi

Bottle: Aroma is hoppy with fruity notes of citrus and grapes. Hazy yellow color, white head. Flavor is light wheaty and yeasty, quite present citrus hops notes and a citrus peel finish bitterness. Quite good.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Citrus aroma. Hazy, yellow, irregular white head, fair lace. Citrus, light citric, light bitter. Thin body. Nelson?? Weizen??

Cloudy orange with a good and permanent white head.
Some fruits(grapes, orange, banana..), wood...
In mouth is not so yeasty like the usual weissbiers. Full of white wine grapes with a medium bitter and dry end. The medium/high carbonations makes it perfect for warm days.
A really solid brew, one of the best of the brewery.
Very rich hybrid aroma, loads of fruit. Hazy gold, rocky head. Hefeweisse mouth feel, and the citrus from the yeast is underlined by the hops. But they could have hopped it even more.

hazy orange colour, huge, stable slightly yellowish off-white head; aroma of citrus, yeast, banana, wine cellar, and hints of sauerkraut; taste of citrusses again, with slight banana notes, wheat, and fresh hoppyness; one of the best weizens I have ever taste; strongly recommended
Ez nem gyümölcsösen komlós búzasör, a la Schneider Hopfen-Weisse, hanem "csak" egy kiegyensúlyozott Sauvignon Blanc, sörben. Viszont annak igazán remek !

500ml bottle from Berlin Bier Shop

Pours dark orange with a tiny head. Aroma of yeast, earthy notes, hints of exotic fruits and banana. Taste is wheaty, malty and fruity with hints of banana, exotic fruits and yeast. Finish is yeasty, fruity and malty. Okay, quite fruity weizen.
Hazy orange color with small head. Aroma is hoppy. Flavor is wheat and hops. Easy to drink, not much carbonation.

50 cl bottle as "Camba Nelson Weisse". Thanks Timo A. BBE 04.01.2014.
Pours hazy orange color with a medium sized head. Aroma of hops, grass, mild wheat, subtle yeast notes and faint goose berry bush. Flavor is wheaty, sweetish with banana and apricot, mild grassy hops and yeast. Refreshing and nicely balanced brew.
3435

Bottle cloudy light orange body with a nice white head aroma is gras with aroma hops taste is aroma hops with some fruits aftertaste is slightly bitter liked this very much very refreshing summer beer had this also last year and think that it was a little bit richer

Drunk in a snifter at BrauKunstLive! 2013 Festival. Their Nelson Weiße was a mini-wow and a 1/2, coming in full citrusy but smelling like grass, not horse blanket, but fresh mown grass. Very refreshing. Their blurb stated "fruity with a strong taste of bananas and Mangos," none of which I got a hint of, still yum.

500 ml bottle as Camba Bavaria Conatus Weisse. 331/10. BB 26/05/2013. From bierzwerg.de.
Hazy orangey golden colour with an average sized frothy white head. 
Wheat, exotic fruity hops, mild yeast and mild grainy maltiness in the aroma. 
The flavour is fruity hops, banana, mild yeast, wheat and a tiny bit of bitterness. Nice hoppy Weizen. Balanced and tasty. Just a little bit thin.

0,5 l swing top bottle  BB 16. Oct 13   Botled as Camba Nelson Weisse  
golden-orange Color, cloudy, frothy, white foam, dough, citrus, banana, bread, hay, cereal, grass, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, Smooth, slick feel, soft carbonation,

500 ml bottle as "Camba Bavaria Conatus Weisse".
Pours a hazy yellow colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of wheat and fresh exotic fruits such as kiwi. Flavour of fresh exotic fruits, juicy floral hops, wheat, malts and mellow caramel. Some banana notes as well, but quite mild. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and smooth mouthfeel. Finishes sweet with juicy exotic fruitiness and floral bitterness. Really refreshing and well balanced. A hefeweizen for my liking, probably one of the best.

500 ml flip-top bottle from Wasanas in Germany. Pours a cloudly orange/gold color with a foamy lasting egg sheel colored head. Aroma is a fantastic herbal citrus and slight banana. A great looking and smelling beer. Taste is cream, citrus, and esters but with great flavor. Palate is smoooth and this a special Hefe in my mind almost gorment. Not a daily beer but a really nice change of pace. Bravo!!!

(draught) pours a slightly murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of light barnyard and hay, orange peel, yeast, black pepper and mint. flavour is mostly the same, lots of wheat and yeast, with a subdued fruitiness and a popcorn finish. medium-bodied with soft carbonation.

50 cl bottle @ home as Camba Conatus Weisse, BBE 18.05.2013
Aroma has fruity notes, some banana esthers, hops, gooseberry bush, hints of wheat and nettles. Flavour has nettles, some fruits, hops, some banana and hints of gooseberry bush. Palate is slightly too high on CO2 at start but gets smoother. Yeasty and a bit stuffy finish. Refreshing and nice.

Pours ocher yellow, cloudy with a high, creamy head. It smells very well balanced yeasty and hoppy, with peach and grape. Starts very fruity and yeasty, hoppy, with lots of grape and peach. In the middle part also hoppy and fruity, again very dominated by grapes. Goes into a yeasty creamy finish, very sweet-fruity and hoppy.

Bottled. A hazy dark golden beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of citrusy hops, malt, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrusy hops, wheat, bread, and barley, leading to a dry wheaty finish.

UPDATED: MAR 4, 2013 Bottle, 50 cl, courtesy of Yespr. Slightly unclear golden with a small, but  decent and stable white head. Aroma is hoppy - peach, sweet tropical fruits, ripe melon. A bready note, too. Delicious sweet fruity flavor balancing a rather dry, light bready malty backbone. Smooth, dry, light yeasty finish. A nice take on the style. Well executed.

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of yespr. Comes as: "Camba Bavaria Conatus Weisse". Pours golden with a small white head. The Nelson Sauvin dominates the nose blending in with the yeast. Medium body, lively carbonation, fruity and yeasty with the NS adding an exotic edge with a little bitterness. 040213
50 cL bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is peachy and grapes fruity. Smooth fruity, peachy and grapes. Sweet and light citrusy bitter. Peachy and citrusy finish.

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Camba Bavaria Conatus Weisse ].Unclear - hazy medium orange colour with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, wheat, moderate hoppy, grass, orange - citrus, dusty hops, moderate yeasty, fruity, banana, peach. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long to average duration, dry, yeasty, hoppy, fruity, peach, citrus hops, cat pis notes. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20121202]

Its unclear orange-golden with a creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of fruit/peach, light yeast and wheat. The flavor is moderately sweet with notes of peach and other exotic fruits, yeast and a little wheat, and the finish is slightly spicy and dry. I think its very interesting, and I really like it, but IMO not a "German" weissbier.

Bügelverschlußflasche: Deep golden, hazy with an oragey sheen, smaller white foamy layer, solid, almost "Belgian" nose: orangey and peachy (-hoppy) fruitiness, combined with a mild yeasty tartness; moderate sweet-sour flavour, nearly medium bodied, both fizzy and soft; lingering aromatic fruity-sourish finish, followed by a tart, but delicate yeasty touch. Great Weizen...

Light yellow colour, small white head. Aroma is very complex, somewhat IPA-like with a lot of citrus fragrances. Taste is more bitter and hoppy than the other weissbiers. Carries a bread-like aftertaste. Awesome beer!

0.5 l bottle, thanks Timo A! Hazy copper color. Sweetish aroma of clove, coriander, hay, gooseberries and petrol. Sweetish spicy and grainy flavor with christmas clove, pepper and coriander. Medium body.  Nice twist on weizen, Nelson seem to work in weizen when restrained.

500ml bottle. Hazy dark golden colour with huge, unstable, frothy, off-white head. Citrussy, hoppy aroma with wheaty and yeasty background, minimally spicy undertones. Taste is citrussy, wheaty, bitter hoppy overtones; wheat and hop mix up to an almost herbal finish.

Bottle (as Camba Bavaria Conatus Weisse 5,9%). Golden, cloudy, small to average and fully diminishing head. Light to moderate malty  wheaty and lightly sweetish aroma, light tropical fruitiness with light banana, some grapefruit - light citrus hoppyness, light yeast. Body is medium, malty  wheaty and lightly sweetish flavor, light tropical fruitiness with light banana, grapefruit - citrus hoppyness. Finish is average, malty  some wheat and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness, some grapefruit - citrus hoppyness. Nice, not so sweet hefeweizen - interesting hoppyness.

Had this as Camba Bavaria Conatus Weisse - same beer. Was told by the brewery that they put "conatus"-labels on all new beers. Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass very zippy, nice head. Wonderful hoppy aroma. Starts intense hoppy-fruity, modest sweet. Only light yeasty notes. Finish very well balanced, mild-hoppy, very drinkable. A bit IPA-like. A great beer!

On tap at Főzdefeszt. Hazy, orange color with creamy, white head. Piney, resiny, floral, hoppy aroma. Later the typical citrus weissbier yeast flavour also appears, but the piney stays the dominant. Medium bitter taste with some hiding sweetness. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation - as a classic hefe weissbier. Piney, hoppy finish. Unique, well hopped hefe weissbier. Its a bit like Schneiders Hopfenweisse, but this piney hoppy taste is different from that Saphir dry-hopped flavour. And Hopfenweisse is a Weizenbock, meanwhile Nelson Weisse is "only" a hefewizen. We can say, that Hopfenweisse is Nelsons "big brother"...

3. Főzdefeszt. Sörmanufaktúra. Az alap búzasör íze kicsit meg van bolondítva egy kis komlóval ami kesernyés lecsengő utóízt eredményez. A búza és a komló összjátékáról a Schneider Weisse Hopfenweisse jut eszembe, onnan lehetne mit tanulni, de így is egy üdítő kis söröcske.

Nagyon kellemes az illata amerikai komlós keveredik a kellemesen édes és friss kokorica bukéjával.  Sajnos az íze már nem ennyire különleges. Nem túl karakteres, vékony és szinte semmi utóíz vagy finom lecsengés nem tapasztalható. Van egy alap búzás gerince a komlóból meg úgy látszik csak az aromáját tolták meg de nagyon a keserűségre nem nagyon mentek rá.
Az tény, hogy egy friss üdítő és nagyobb mennyiségben is iható sör.

Ködös mélyebb aranyszínű főzet közepes habképződéssel, amely végül ujjnyi vastagságban megállapodik.
Fanyar, frissítő aromájában némi rágógumi, méz, fehér kenyérbél, citrusok és nem utolsósorban az egész főzetet átható friss, virágos komló.
Közepesen száraz befejezése fanyar citrusos, komlós és finoman fűszeres. Kiváló.

Vollmundiger Hopfengeruch, der im Antrunk zum Teil erschmeckbar ist. Das Bier ist dort hefiger als gedacht und leicht süß, eine wirkliche Bitterkeit ist nicht spürbar. Etwas herb. Das Bier verändert sich nicht großartig, früh beginnen die Aromen in einen abkligenden Status überzugehen. 9/8/9/8//8

swing top bottle 500ml. -from Sörspecialista.hu. Visited this newly open beershop/bar with three friends and each of us ordered different weizen. Of course, this one was my choice. Murky orange coloured, small to medium sized white head, fruity hoppy, IPA like nose. Bitter hoppy and intensive fruity taste with mild notes of wheat and hint of spices. Very fresh and aromatic regardless (minimal) lack of body. Real surprise indeed. All four of us were delighted with this beer.
